ref.mixed-citation:
Lu R
,
Zhao X
,
Li J
Genomic characterisation and epidemiology of 2019 novel coronavirus: implications for virus origins and re0eptor binding. Lancet 395( 10224), 565– 574 ( 2020). 32007145

note.p: • This research showed that sequences of SARS-CoV-2 obtained from nine patients had 88% identity to two bat-derived SARS-like coronaviruses, bat-SL-CoVZC45 and bat-SL-CoVZXC21, collected in 2018 in Zhoushan, eastern China, but were more distant from SARS-CoV (about 79%) and MERS-CoV (about 50%). The research indicated that SARS-CoV-2 fell within the subgenus Sarbecovirus of the genus Betacoronavirus.
